abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis’s legacy as chief executive of Bank of America will likely be determined by whether his successor can do what Mr. Lewis couldn’t: prove that the bank’s messy acquisition of Merrill Lynch was worth the money.
snippet: Kenneth D. Lewis’s legacy as chief executive of Bank of America will likely be determined by whether his successor can do what Mr. Lewis couldn’t: prove that the bank’s messy acquisition of Merrill Lynch was worth the money.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis’s legacy as chief executive of Bank of America  will likely be determined by whether his successor can do what Mr. Lewis couldn’t: prove that the bank’s messy acquisition of Merrill Lynch was worth the money, The Associated Press writes.

headline.main: Who Will Be BofA’s Next Chief?

abstract: Wall Street analysts, lawmakers and the New York State Attorney General weighed in Thursday on Kenneth Lewis’s decision to retire early from Bank of America.
snippet: Wall Street analysts, lawmakers and the New York State Attorney General weighed in Thursday on Kenneth Lewis’s decision to retire early from Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America‘s shares moved lower in midmorning trading Thursday as investors absorbed the not-so-shocking news that Kenneth Lewis would be leaving the corner office at Bank of America by the end of the year.

headline.main: Wall St. and Washington React to BofA News

abstract: Jim Cramer, the former hedge fund who hosts CNBC’s “Mad Money,” said Brian Moynihan was the odds-on favorite to by Bank of America’s next chief. But hedge fund manager Doug Kass isn’t so sure.
snippet: Jim Cramer, the former hedge fund who hosts CNBC’s “Mad Money,” said Brian Moynihan was the odds-on favorite to by Bank of America’s next chief. But hedge fund manager Doug Kass isn’t so sure.
lead_paragraph: Who should lead Bank of America next? It’s a question that has market watchers squabbling on the Web.

headline.main: Jim Cramer’s Money Is on Moynihan for BofA Chief

abstract: Robert J. McCann, the former head of Merrill Lynch’s wealth management unit, has settled his lawsuit over his contract, freeing him to take another job in financial services, perhaps with UBS.
snippet: Robert J. McCann, the former head of Merrill Lynch’s wealth management unit, has settled his lawsuit over his contract, freeing him to take another job in financial services, perhaps with UBS.
lead_paragraph: Robert J. McCann, the former head of Merrill Lynch’s wealth management unit, has settled his lawsuit against Bank of America over his contract, freeing him to take another job in financial services, perhaps with UBS.

headline.main: McCann Settles Lawsuit Against Bank of America
